title: Software Engineer II
description:
**About Ping Identity:**
 At Ping Identity, we believe in making digital experiences both secure and seamless for all users, without compromise. We call this digital freedom. And it's not just something we provide our customers. It's something that inspires our company. People don't come here to join a culture that's built on digital freedom. They come to cultivate it.
   

  

 Our intelligent, cloud identity platform lets people shop, work, bank, and interact wherever and however they want. Without friction. Without fear.
   

  

 While protecting digital identities is at the core of our technology, protecting individual identities is at the core of our culture. We champion every identity. One of our core values, Respect Individuality, reminds us to celebrate differences so you are empowered to bring your authentic self to work.
   

  

 We're headquartered in Denver, Colorado and we have offices and employees around the globe. We serve the largest, most demanding enterprises worldwide, including more than half of the Fortune 100\\. At Ping Identity, we're changing the way people and businesses think about cybersecurity, digital experiences, and identity and access management.
   

  

 Ping is looking for looking for Golang developer who can build optimized, scalable, and modular software using required technologies. You are tasked with designing and developing back\\-end components and connecting applications to other web services. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in Go programming, backend development, and microservices architecture. You should be proficient in RESTful APIs, cloud services, distributed systems, and high\\-performance caching.
   

  

**What You'll Do:**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable, efficient, and high\\-performance Golang APIs.
* Deploy and manage applications in cloud environments, ensuring high availability and performance.
* Contribute to code reviews, testing, and continuous integration processes.
* Ensure code quality, security, and optimal performance of applications.
* Develop software and algorithms to solve business challenges while maintaining scalability, reliability, and security.
* Provide task estimations and deliver high\\-quality code on schedule.
* Build robust message\\-oriented middleware components.


**What Weâ€™re Looking For:**
* B.E/B.Tech with 5\\+ yearsâ€™ experience in software development
* Strong knowledge of Golang programming language
* Other programming experience can also be considered: C, C\\+\\+
* Working Experience with AWS, GCP or Azure clouds with the respective clouds SDK usage
* Experience in micro services architecture and container\\-based software using Kubernetes,
* nomad, Mesos, OpenShift and Docker, rkt or other container technologies


**Life at Ping:**
 We believe in and facilitate a flexible, collaborative work environment. Weâ€™re growing quickly, but remain true to the innovative, can\\-do startup values that got us here. Most importantly, we keep hiring talented, smart, fun, and genuinely nice people because thatâ€™s who we want to succeed with every day.
   

  

**Here are just a few of the things that make Ping special:**
* A company culture that empowers you to do your best work.
* Employee Resource Groups that create a sense of belonging for everyone.
* Regular company and team bonding events.
* Competitive benefits and perks.
* Global volunteering and community initiatives


**Our Benefits:**
* Generous PTO \\& Holiday Schedule
* Parental Leave
* Progressive Healthcare Options
* Retirement Programs
* Opportunity for Education Reimbursement
* Commuter Offset (Specific locations)


 Ping is the collective sum of all our individual experiences, backgrounds and influences and we pride ourselves in growing and learning together. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse environment where everyoneâ€™s individuality is respected and everyone has an Identity. In recruiting for new colleagues, we welcome the unique contributions you can bring and encourage you to be your best self.
   

  

*We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.*

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
YouTrip is the leading and fastest\\-growing multi\\-currency payment platform in Asia Pacific. In 2018, we pioneered the region's first multi\\-currency digital wallet. Now, YouTrip is the \\#1 multi\\-currency digital wallet trusted by millions across the region, processing over US$15 billion in total payment value annually.Â 
 



 Our consumer and business propositions \\- YouTrip and YouBiz \\- empower individuals and businesses with inclusive, accessible, and affordable financial solutions. YouTrip has raised over US$110 million to date, including its recent Series B round led by global venture capital firm Lightspeed Venture Partnersâ€”underscoring strong investor confidence in its mission to transform digital financial services across the Asia Pacific.Â 
 



 Recognised as World Economic Forum's Global Innovator 2025, CNBC's World's Top Fintech Companies (2025, 2024\\), and LinkedIn's Top Startup (2025, 2024, 2023\\), YouTrip is dedicated to creating the next generation of digital finance services for consumers and businesses.
 



 Valuing an entrepreneurial culture of diversity and inclusion, we are seeking driven individuals to join our fast\\-growing regional team as we push the boundaries of innovative fintech solutions.
 



 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Staff Software Engineer with an exceptional command of backend tech to join our dynamic team. As a Staff Software Engineer, you play a crucial role in the design, development, testing, and maintenance of software systems. This position requires a high level of technical expertise, leadership, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross\\-functional teams.
 



 Responsibilities:
 


* Design, develop, and maintain high\\-quality software solutions in accordance with project requirements and coding standards
* Take ownership of complex technical challenges and drive them to resolution, leveraging advanced technical skills and problem\\-solving abilities
* Mentor and guide junior engineers, providing technical leadership, code reviews, and constructive feedback to support their growth and development
* Take ownership of several software components, ensuring their robustness, availability, and scalability
* Participate in architectural discussions and contribute to the design and implementation of scalable and reliable software systems
* Plan and execute projects, ensuring efficient and on\\-time delivery of software products
* Lead by example in adhering to best practices for software development, including version control, testing, documentation, and deployment processes
* Troubleshoot and debug complex issues in production environments, working collaboratively with operations and support teams to ensure timely resolution
* Contribute to the recruitment and hiring process by participating in interviews, evaluation candidates, and providing input on hiring decisions
* Star current with industry trends, advancements, and best practices in software engineering, sharing knowledge and insights with the broader team
* Actively participate in code reviews, design discussions, and sprint planning meetings to contribute to the overall success of the team and projects


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, or a related field
* 8\\+ years of experience in software development, with substantial experience in backend and cloud infrastructure
* Expert\\-level proficiency in designing and developing high\\-performance, concurrent applications with Golang.
* Knowledge on other languages like Java, Python, or Ruby will be an added advantage
* Having prior experience in FinTech domains would be an added advantage
* Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles
* Experience with distributed systems, microservices architecture, and cloud native computing.
* Solid knowledge of software testing methodologies and tools, including unit testing and integration testing for backend applications
* Demonstrated ability to lead projects, collaborate effectively with teams, and mentor junior engineers
* Excellent problem\\-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to tackle complex technical challenges

title: UI Developer
description:
**Job Title:** 
 UI Developer
 



**Required Experience:** 
 4â€“7 Years Experience
 



**Location:** 
 Noida, Dehradun â€“
 **On\\-site (5 days/week)** 




**Employment Type:** 
 Full\\-time
 







**Job Summary** 




 Weâ€™re building a mission\\-critical analytics platform that processes millions of data points daily for thousands of professionals. The work you do will directly affect the speed, accuracy, and usability of a platform.
 



 This role is perfect for engineers who are already strong in modern front\\-end development and want to deepen their expertise in real\\-time systems, high\\-performance data visualization, and scalable architectures.
 







**What Youâ€™ll Do** 




 Â· Develop high\\-performance, responsive applications using React and TypeScript.
 



 Â· Implement real\\-time streaming using Server\\-Sent Events (SSE), WebSockets, and Pub/Sub messaging with fallback strategies.
 



 Â· Build data\\-rich visualizations with Apache ECharts, D3\\.js, or Highcharts.
 



 Â· Optimize UI performance for large\\-scale datasets and thousands of concurrent users.
 



 Â· Write and maintain unit, integration, and E2E tests.
 



 Â· Collaborate with designers, backend engineers, and product managers in an Agile environment.
 



 Â· Ensure accessibility compliance.
 



 Â· Debug, troubleshoot, and fix production issues.
 







**Must\\-Have Skills** 




 Â· React \\& TypeScript
 



 Â· JavaScript (ES6\\+) fundamentals
 



 Â· Data visualization libraries: Apache ECharts, D3\\.js, Highcharts, Chart.js, or Recharts
 



 Â· SSE, WebSockets, Pub/Sub messaging
 



 Â· SCSS/SASS, CSS Modules, or CSS\\-in\\-JS
 



 Â· State management
 



 Â· REST and GraphQL API integration
 



 Â· Performance optimization techniques
 



 Â· Accessibility best practices
 



 Â· Git\\-based workflow
 







**Preferred Skills** 




 Â· Experience in analytics and dashboards
 



 Â· Micro\\-frontend architectures (Webpack Module Federation, Single\\-SPA)
 



 Â· Component library creation and npm publishing
 



 Â· CI/CD pipelines, Docker
 



 Â· PWA development

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Location:** 
 Open / Hybrid / Remote
 


**Experience:** 
 3\\-4 years
   


**About Mavdero** 




 At
 **Mavdero** 
 , we design and build enterprise\\-grade digital platforms that scale across companies, products, and geographies. We specialize in complex ServiceNow implementations where workflow automation, integrations, and customer/partner experience are critical to success. We value deep technical expertise, ownership, and engineers who lead by example.
 


**Role Overview** 

 We are seeking a
 **Lead ServiceNow Developer** 
 with strong hands\\-on expertise and technical leadership skills. You will lead the development of
 **Digital Workflow (WDF) automations** 
 , integrations, and customer/partner\\-facing solutions in large, multi\\-company ServiceNow environments supporting multiple software products sold directly and indirectly.
 


**Key Responsibilities** 
* Lead the design and development of
 **WDF automations** 
 using Flow Designer, IntegrationHub, and scripting where required
* Architect and implement
 **integrations** 
 between ServiceNow and external systems
* Lead and contribute to implementations of
 **SOM, CSM, and/or SPM** 
 (experience with more than one is strongly preferred)
* Design, build, and customize
 **Customer and Partner Portals**
* Deliver solutions in
 **single\\-instance, multi\\-company ServiceNow environments**
* Support complex business models involving
 **multiple software products and partner ecosystems**
* Provide technical leadership through
 **code reviews, mentoring, and best practices**
* Collaborate with architects, consultants, and business stakeholders to deliver scalable, maintainable solutions


**Required Skills \\& Experience** 
* Strong hands\\-on experience with
 **ServiceNow WDF automation and integrations**
* Proven implementation experience with
 **SOM, CSM, or SPM** 
 (multiple modules preferred)
* Experience working in
 **multi\\-company setups within a single ServiceNow instance**
* Solid experience with
 **Customer and/or Partner Portal development**
* Strong ServiceNow scripting skills (JavaScript, Glide APIs)
* Ability to balance
 **hands\\-on delivery with technical leadership**


**ServiceNow Certification Requirements** 

**Mandatory:** 



* **ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA)**



**Strongly Preferred (one or more):** 



* **Certified Application Developer (CAD)**
* **Certified Implementation Specialist â€“ Customer Service Management (CIS\\-CSM)**
* **Certified Implementation Specialist â€“ Service Operations Management (CIS\\-SOM)**
* **Certified Implementation Specialist â€“ Strategic Portfolio Management (CIS\\-SPM)**



**Nice to Have:** 



* **Certified Integration Specialist** 
 (IntegrationHub)
* **Certified Implementation Specialist â€“ ITSM**
* **Certified Technical Architect (CTA)** 
 or active progress toward CTA
* Experience maintaining certifications across multiple ServiceNow releases

title: UNPAID INTERNSHIP - Backend and Integration Engineer
description:
**Location: Remote \\| Duration: 6 Months \\| Stipend: Zero \\| Hiring: 1â€“2 Backend Commandos** 




  





**BACKEND \\& INTEGRATION COMMANDO WANTED** 




  





**THE MISSION â€” READ THIS OR DONâ€™T BOTHER** 




 We're building a B2B HR tech product from ZERO to REVENUE in 30 days.
 



 If you don't live for building scalable systems under impossible deadlines, close this tab now.
 



 This isn't a backend job. This is a production battlefield.
 



 We need 1â€“2 absolutely insane engineers who can build the plumbing, integrations, and APIs that will make or break us.
 



  





**WE'RE NOT OFFERING:** 




 Money (we're bootstrapping to survive)
 



 Clean, well\\-documented legacy systems
 



 Time to "architect" â€” you architect while building
 



 Hand\\-holding or corporate training programs
 



  





**WE'RE OFFERING:** 




 Real scars from building scalable backends that actually scale
 



 Actual enterprise integration experience â€” not tutorial projects
 



 A portfolio that proves you can connect anything to anything
 



 Stories about that time you integrated Zoho while debugging Supabase at 3 AM
 



 Potential equity if you survive and want to keep going
 



  





**THE INSANE PLAN** 




  





**PHASE 1: BATTLE MODE** 




 Goal: MVP backend that doesn't collapse under first 100 users
 



 Week 1: Supabase schema design \\+ API contracts
 



 Week 2â€“3: Building integrations while the frontend team breathes down your neck
 



 Week 4: Debugging live while we sell to actual businesses
 



  





**PHASE 2: SURVIVAL MODE** 




 Goal: Keep the backend alive when everything breaks
 



 Handle real customer data without leaking it
 



 Integrate GCP because our server costs are exploding
 



 Connect Zoho Billing because we need to actually get paid
 



**PHASE 3: GROWTH MODE** 




 Goal: Scale or watch the database catch fire
 



 Optimize queries that are slowing everything down
 



 Build APIs that enterprise clients won't laugh at
 



 Either we make it or we learn why our backend couldn't handle it
 



  





**WHAT YOU'LL ACTUALLY DO** 




 Design Supabase schemas at 2 AM because we need it live yesterday
 



 Build REST/GraphQL APIs that connect our AI models to the frontend
 



 Integrate GCP services when our cheap server explodes
 



 Connect Zoho Billing because revenue \\> pretty code
 



 Debug integration hell when three services break at once
 



 Talk to enterprise IT teams without sounding like an idiot
 



 Deploy to production and pray it doesn't crash immediately
 



  





**NON\\-NEGOTIABLE TECH STACK** 




 Core Stack (You Must Know This):
 



 Supabase â€” schema design, RLS, migrations, real\\-time
 



 PostgreSQL â€” if you don't know indexes, don't apply
 



 Node.js/Express or Python/FastAPI â€” pick your weapon
 



 REST/GraphQL APIs â€” build them, test them, break them, fix them
 



 Git/GitHub â€” your lifeline
 



 Integration Battlefield (You Will Learn This):
 



 GCP â€” Cloud SQL, IAM, Pub/Sub, and why cloud bills hurt
 



 Zoho API â€” because businesses need to pay us
 



 Enterprise authentication â€” OAuth, JWT, SSO, security that doesn't suck
 



 Message queues â€” when async is the difference between working and dead
 



  





**WHO WE WANT** 




 The Backend Commando:
 



 Someone who sees "scale to enterprise" as a fun Friday night
 



 An engineer who'd rather build something that works than something that's beautiful
 



 A human who can talk to clients and code in the same hour
 



 Someone who understands that "production\\-ready" means "won't crash at 3 AM"
 



  





**MINIMUM BATTLE REQUIREMENTS** 




 Hands\\-on Supabase experience â€” show us schemas you've built
 



 API design skills â€” REST/GraphQL, documentation, testing
 



 PostgreSQL knowledge â€” queries, optimization, WTF is an index
 



 Cloud exposure â€” GCP, AWS, or Azure â€” you've deployed something
 



 Integration experience â€” connected APIs that actually matter
 



 Located in India \\+ available 15â€“20 hours/week for 6 months
 



 Problem\\-solving mindset â€” when it breaks, you fix it, no whining
 



  





**NICE\\-TO\\-HAVE (BUT WE'LL TEACH YOU):** 




 Experience with enterprise SaaS integrations
 



 Knowledge of CI/CD, Docker, DevOps
 



 Familiarity with authentication/authorization flows
 



 Exposure to message queues or event\\-driven systems
 



  





**SELECTION PROCESS** 




 Step 1: Prove You're Not Normal
 



 Show us a Supabase schema you designed or an API you built that solved a real problem
 



 Step 2: Battle Test
 



 We'll give you a real integration problem and 48 hours to build a solution
 



 Step 3: Reality Check
 



 We'll tell you exactly how impossible this is. If you're still interested, you're in.
 



  





**THE HARD TRUTH** 




 This will be the hardest backend work of your life. You will:
 



 Debug database locks at 4 AM
 



 Explain to founders why their "simple feature" requires a migration
 



 Integrate systems with documentation from 2008
 



 Question every life choice that led you here
 



 Probably dream in SQL
 



  





 But you'll also:
 



 Learn more about scalable backends in 6 months than most engineers learn in 5 years
 



 Build a portfolio that makes recruiters throw money at you
 



 Understand what it actually takes to run production systems
 



 Either help build something amazing or learn exactly why it failed
 



  





**HOW TO APPLY** 




 If you're still reading this and thinking "I want to build that backend":
 


1. Send your GitHub (or project links)
2. One paragraph on why you're the right kind of crazy
3. One example of an integration you built or scaled



  





 Application deadline: When we find 1â€“2 backend commandos who won't quit.
 



  





 "If your backend doesn't keep you up at night, it's not important enough."
 



  





 â€” Someone who probably fixed a production issue while writing this
 



 Come build the plumbing for something impossible with us.

title: Senior Web Developer (OpenCart, Shopify)
description:
**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking an experienced Senior Web Developer with strong expertise in Shopify to
 



 design, develop, and deliver a high\\-quality, scalable eCommerce website. The role involves
 



 building a new Shopify store in parallel while leading the migration from OpenCart to
 



 Shopify, ensuring minimal disruption and a seamless go\\-live. This position requires hands\\-on development capability, technical ownership, and close collaboration with internal stakeholders and existing development teams.
 



 Â 
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Design, build, and customize a high\\-performance Shopify eCommerce website
* Lead end\\-to\\-end migration of products, content, customer data, and SEO structure from
 **OpenCart** 
 to
 **Shopify**
* Ensure best practices in site architecture, UX, performance, and security
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders, designers, and existing developers
* Conduct thorough testing and support launch and post\\-go\\-live stabilization
* Identify and resolve technical issues proactively to ensure site reliability and scalability



  





**Qualifications** 



* Strong hands\\-on experience with
 **Shopify (Liquid, HTML, CSS, JavaScript)**
* Proven track record of delivering production\\-grade Shopify stores
* Experience with eCommerce platform migrations, preferably
 **OpenCart to Shopify**
* Solid understanding of site performance, scalability, and best\\-practice UX
* Strong communication skills with a clear ownership and problem\\-solving mindset



  





**Nice To Have:** 



* Experience with Shopify Plus
* Knowledge of eCommerce SEO and performance optimization
* Prior experience working with UK\\-based clients or stakeholders

 Client Name:KLA India

**MUST HAVES** 




 Education/qualification: Only from premier Institute like IIT, IISC, and Top international universities.Â 
 



 Minimum Qualifications :Fresh MSc/Mtec graduates with relevant academic projects or
 



 Master's Level Degree and 0 years related work experience; or Bachelor's Level Degree and related work experience of 2 years
 



 Source for candiadtes from Statistics and Maths background
 



 Either academic Internship/Projects or Min 1 year Computer vision and Image processing experience
 



 Min 1 yr exp in C\\+\\+ and Linux is a MUST
 



 Hands\\-on experience with tools like OpenCV, scikit\\-image, or MATLAB.
 



 Excellent communication skills both Verbal and written.
 



 Excellent knowledge on Image processing and Computer vision
 



 Experience on Machine learning and Deep learning
 



 Product or Semi conductor or Hardware Manufacturing company experience is a MUST. Candidates from engineering product companies have higher chances of getting shortlisted (current company or past experience)

title: Flutter developer Intern
description:
**Company Description**
  

 Arutis Technologies is a cutting\\-edge IT and SaaS company dedicated to developing scalable, secure, and user\\-friendly digital solutions. By collaborating with startups, SMEs, and enterprises, Arutis transforms ideas into impactful mobile apps, web platforms, AI\\-powered systems, and cloud\\-based SaaS solutions. Leveraging strong engineering and advanced technology, the company delivers reliable and future\\-ready products. With expertise spanning mobile app development, web applications, AI/automation, and cloud deployment, Arutis serves clients globally, creating digital solutions tailored for modern needs. The company is headquartered in India and focuses on innovation and growth\\-driven technology services.
   

  

**Role Description**
  

 This is a full\\-time remote role for a Flutter Developer Intern. The ideal candidate will assist in building mobile applications using Flutter, collaborating with the development team, and ensuring high\\-quality code implementation. The responsibilities include writing clean and reusable code, debugging and troubleshooting, developing new features, and optimizing apps for performance. The intern will also participate in coding reviews, testing, and maintaining application documentation.
   

  

**Qualifications**
  

* Strong foundation in Computer Science concepts
* Proficiency in Back\\-End Web Development and Software Development
* Experience with Programming and Object\\-Oriented Programming (OOP)
* Eagerness to learn new technologies and adapt to team workflows
* Strong problem\\-solving and analytical skills
* Effective communication and teamwork abilities
* Relevant academic background in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field

title: Application Engineer, Adv
description:
**Overview**
 Keysight is at the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our \\~15,000 employees create world\\-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Learn more about what we do.
   

  

 Our award\\-winning culture embraces a bold vision of where technology can take us and a passion for tackling challenging problems with industry\\-first solutions. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers.
   

  

 Optical Application Engineers play a pivotal role in enabling advanced optical solutions across diverse domains. Their expertise spans imaging, illumination, lighting, and photonics, ensuring optimal performance and high yield rates for products in industries such as automotive, general lighting, display technologies, and more. These engineers drive innovation by bridging cutting\\-edge optical design engineering solutions with real\\-world applications.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**What Youâ€™ll Be Doing:**
* Support pre\\-sales activities by providing technical guidance, demonstrations, and resource coordination to help customers evaluate and adopt Keysight solutions.
* Provide proactive technical support for customers and prospects across imaging, illumination, lighting, and photonics applications.
* Partnering with the sales and marketing teams to understand and meet customersâ€™ technical and business challenges.
* Identifying, diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving issues in a customer environment.
* Gather and filter customer feedback to provide clear, actionable insights for improving product usability and adoption.
* Prepare and organize technical resources for support, training, webinars, and customer visits.
* Share analyzed and structured information with internal teams to facilitate discussion and enable appropriate resource allocation.


**The Impact You Will Have**
* Enhancing customer satisfaction and loyalty through exceptional technical communications.
* Driving the adoption and usability of Keysight' optical system design and analysis software.
* Facilitating the successful implementation of cutting\\-edge optical solutions in diverse industries.
* Contributing to the continuous improvement of Keysight' products based on customer feedback and insights.
* Strengthening Keysight' reputation as a leader in optical system design and analysis software.


**Qualifications**
**What Youâ€™ll Need:**
* Bachelor, Master. in Optics, Optical Sciences, Engineering, Physics, or related fields.
* Experience with optical design tools and illumination or photonics software is a plus.
* Strong communication, analytical and troubleshooting skills.
* Excellent English communication skills.


**Who You Are**
* Skilled in problem\\-solving and managing concurrent projects.
* Strong interpersonal and organizational abilities.
* Proactive, detail\\-oriented, and self\\-motivated.
* Skilled at uncovering critical details through effective customer communication.
* Proficient in analyzing gathered information and presenting key findings to the team for discussion.
* Willing to travel domestically and occasionally internationally.
